intro: Elegia aggregata, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States and southeastern Canada. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, round fruits called schizocarps. Elegia aggregata is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
